perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (including amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned shall be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (excluding amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned shall be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that amendments on Schedule 13D are *not* included in the agreement for joint filing, while the original text states that they *are* included. This creates uncertainty as to whether Schedule 13D amendments require individual filing or are covered by the joint agreement, leading to potential compliance issues and legal disputes.

perturbation.original_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.changed_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, CEO (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a minor contradiction by changing Adam D. Portnoy's title at ABP TRUST from 'President' to 'CEO'. While seemingly small, this creates uncertainty about his official capacity and authority within the ABP TRUST, potentially affecting the validity of his signature and the agreement's enforceability if internal company structures demand different authorization based on these titles.
